definition: to become civilized/to be open-minded/(of ice) to thaw

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
variant of 花[hua1]
to publicize/openness (of government, PRC equivalent of "glasnost")
Kaihua county in Quzhou 衢州[Qu2 zhou1], Zhejiang
semicivilized

sentences.english: Supposing that the chimpanzees were to be civilized by us, would they be happer for it?
sentences.chinese: 就算咱們把猩猩都開化了，它們因此更幸福嗎？

sentences.english: Jew, circumcised and uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian , slave and free;
sentences.chinese: 未開化的，奴隸或自由人等的分別。

sentences.english: His book describes the march of the civilization of a primitive society.
sentences.chinese: 他的“着作”描述了一個原始社會的開化過程。

sentences.english: Sceptics point out that due process requires discretion.
sentences.chinese: 懷疑派則指出應該謹慎推行公開化。

sentences.english: Some say it is wild and uncivilized.
sentences.chinese: 有些人說這是一片未開化的蠻荒之地。

sentences.english: Although there is no small favors, but the price open, product quality is not bad.
sentences.chinese: 雖然沒有小恩小惠，但價格公開化，商品質量還不錯。

sentences.english: It's not that we are not enlightened, we just had a different history.
sentences.chinese: 並非是我們不開化，只是我們的歷史情況不同。

sentences.english: Schools will help to civilize the wild tribes there.
sentences.chinese: 學校教育將有助於使那裏的野蠻部落逐步開化。

sentences.english: The original porcelain factory, will build for becoming civilized in the temple in ancient times under the foot of large Foshan of Rong County.
sentences.chinese: 榮縣大佛山腳下原來的瓷廠，將修建爲古時的開化寺。

sentences.english: It requires confidence, openness, and letting go of defenses.
sentences.chinese: 這個過程需要信心，開化以及放開戒備。

sentences.english: The tribal dance was a spectacle of barbaric splendour.
sentences.chinese: 部落舞展示了一場五顏六色的半開化先民的奇觀。

sentences.english: It typically explodes into the open at some point.
sentences.chinese: 它通常會在某個時間點上突然公開化。

sentences.english: The first section is The Civilization Of The Ancient Ling Nati.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分《古代嶺南的開化》。

sentences.english: And this semi-public link to the broader net leaves vital systems potentially open to attack.
sentences.chinese: 這種半公開化的寬帶連接讓重要的系統容易受到襲擊。

sentences.english: That opened up in public the possibility that the currency union might not be forever.
sentences.chinese: 此舉將歐元區不會永遠存續的可能性公開化了。
就像是未曾開化的運算系統。

definition: long life
Lingbao county level city in Sanmenxia 三門峽|三门峡[San1 men2 xia2], Henan
to pass on the light of Buddha
founding master of a monastery/founder/originator
Mt Luofushan in Zengcheng county, Guangdong
Yanshou county in Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Heilongjiang/to extend life
to present tribute (to the emperor)
Amur cork tree (Phellodendron amurense)/cork-tree bark (Chinese medicine)
Nêdong county, Tibetan: Sne gdong rdzong, in Lhokha prefecture 山南地區|山南地区[Shan1 nan2 di4 qu1], Tibet
Zen Buddhism
to concoct pills of immortality
Classic on Medical Problems, c. 1st century AD/abbr. for 黃帝八十一難經|黄帝八十一难经[Huang2 di4 Ba1 shi2 yi1 Nan4 jing1]
all/various
surname Zhu
to return/to come back
founder (of a craft, religious sect etc)
Northeast China/Manchuria/lit. east of Shanhai Pass 山海關|山海关[Shan1 hai3 guan1]/Kantō region of Japan
